isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - FE 300, RE 200, RE 300 - FE 300 GAUGES AND WARNING LIGHTS - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcprocinfo.para: Before beginning these test procedures, do the following:

item.para: Make sure the vehicle batteries are at 75% state of charge (SOC) or higher. This represents an open circuit voltage (OCV) of 12.4 volts. Batteries with an OCV of 12 volts or less are either completely discharged or have a dead cell.
Check any light or indicator lamp filaments that are suspected of being open (burned out). This is done to avoid unnecessary extensive circuit checks.
Inspect all connectors for loose or damaged pins, wires, etc. Refer to TEST EQUIPMENT AND CONNECTOR REPAIR section in GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in the Master Service Manual.

When the technician determines that a fuse is blown, while checking its condition, he is directed to locate the cause of the overload condition and to repair it. While no further instruction on this procedure is listed in the diagnostic tables, the common procedure is as follows: isolate sections of the circuit by disconnecting connectors, and measure the resistance to ground to find the circuit that is shorted to ground. Then locate the damaged spot in the wire or connector and repair.

Diagnostics for circuits that are malfunctioning by sticking in the on position are generally not covered in detail. It is assumed that the technician knows to check for a malfunctioning switch, relay, or solenoid.

entry.para: Remove fuse F22 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F22, measure voltage from circuit A13F to ground.
Install fuse. Go to next step.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A13/A13F, then repair. Install fuse.
Disconnect green connector (10) from cluster. Turn key on and measure voltage from circuit A28A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A28A, then repair.
At connector (10), measure voltage across circuit A28A to A28-GA.
Locate cause of open or poor connection in circuits A28-GA/ A11-GB/ A11-G, then repair.
At connector (10), install jumper wire from circuit A28A to A31. Disconnect sender connector (38). Turn key on and measure voltage from circuit A31 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A31 or conn. (A2 or A2A), then repair.
At connector (38), measure voltage across circuit K31 to K31-G.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuits K31-G/ A11-GD, then repair.
Remove jumper wire and reconnect cluster connector (10) and sender connector (38).
Transmission oil temperature gauge circuitry checks good. If condition still persists, refer to CTS-5228 to diagnose the gauge and sender.
Remove fuse F22 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F22, measure voltage from circuit A13F to ground.
Install fuse. Go to next step.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A13/A13F, then repair. Install fuse.
Disconnect green connector (11) from cluster. Turn key on and measure voltage from circuit A28B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A28/A28B, then repair.
At connector (11), measure voltage across circuit A28B to A28-G.
Locate cause of open or poor connection in circuits A28-G/ A11-GB/ A11-G, then repair.
At connector (11), install jumper wire from circuit A28B to A36. Disconnect sender connector (37). Turn key on and measure voltage from circuit A36 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A36 or conn. (2 or A2A), then repair.
At connector (37), measure voltage across circuit K36 to K36-G.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuits K36-G/ K11-GD, then repair.
Remove jumper wire and reconnect cluster connector (11) and sender connector (37).
Fuel level gauge circuitry checks good. If condition still persists, refer to S08313 to diagnose the gauge and sender.

svcsubproc.title: Hydraulic Brake Low Fluid and Parking Brake Warning Light System and Bulb Check

table.title: Hydraulic Brake Low Fluid and Parking Brake Warning Light System and Bulb Check

entry.para: Do both bulbs operate when key switch is in the start position?
Does the low brake fluid warning light operate properly?
With parking brake applied, does the parking brake warning light operate properly?
Disconnect parking brake switch connector (N/L). At circuit K44-G, measure resistance to ground.
Park brake sw. (N/L), K44-G to gnd.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit K44-G/ K11-GD or start motor ground, then repair.
At park brake switch connector, install jumper wire from circuit K44B to ground and turn key on. Does light work?
Disconnect natural dash connector (12). Turn key on and measure voltage from circuit A28C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit A28C/A28A, then repair.
At connector (12), measure voltage across circuit A28C and A44A.
Replace cluster. Go to next step.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A44A, or conn. (2), then repair. Go to next step.
Remove jumper wire and reconnect connectors. Park brake circuitry checks OK.
Remove low brake fluid level sensor connector (90). At connector, measure resistance from circuit A11-GF to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuits A11-GE, A11-GE, conn. (88), (84), or ground connections, then repair.
At connector, install jumper wire from circuit A90P to ground. Does light operate?
Remove low brake fluid light connector (89). Turn key on and measure voltage from circuit A90R to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A90R/A28A, then repair.
At connector (89), measure voltage across circuit A90R and A90V.
Replace bulb/ socket assy. (89). Go to next step.
Locate open or poor connection in circuits A90V, A90P, or conn. (84), (88), then repair. Go to next step.
Remove jumper wire and reconnect connectors. Low brake fluid light circuitry checks good.
Disconnect key switch (20). Hold switch in start position and measure resistance from ground terminal of switch to its case.
Reconnect connector (20) and disconnect park brake switch connector (N/L). With key in start position, measure resistance from circuit A44 to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A44, conn. (2), or platform ground, then repair.
Reconnect park brake switch connector and disconnect low brake fluid diode (82). With key in start position, measure resistance of circuit A90X to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A90X, then repair.
With multimeter in diode test mode, check blocking diode (82). Is diode good?
Reconnect blocking diode and disconnect brake fluid light connector (89). With key in start position, measure resistance of circuit A90V to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A90V/A90W, then repair.
Bulb check ground circuitry checks good. If bulbs still do not operate properly, go to Step 2 and 3.

svcsubproc.title: Low Air Pressure Warning Light and Alarm System

table.title: Low Air Pressure Warning Light and Alarm System

entry.para: With air pressure below 60 psi, do BOTH the warning light and alarm fail to operate?
With air pressure below 60 psi, does the alarm operate but the warning light does not?
With air pressure below 60 psi, does the warning light operate properly but the alarm does not?
At low air pressure switch (717), remove connector and jumper circuit K40 to ground. Turn key ON. Does the warning system work?
Disconnect alarm (211) and measure resistance from cavity A to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A40 or conn. (2), then repair.
Remove jumper and reconnect switch (717) and alarm (211). Warning system ground circuitry checks good.
Remove fuse F22 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F22, measure voltage from circuit A13F to ground.
Install fuse. Go to next step.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A13/A13F, then repair. Install fuse.
Disconnect yellow connector (10) from IP cluster. Turn key on and measure voltage from circuit A28A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A28/A28A, then repair.
Remove alarm (211) and install jumper from cavity A to ground. At connector (10), measure voltage across circuit A28A to A40A.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit A40A, then repair.
Remove bulb and check for open condition. Is bulb OK?
Replace IP cluster. Go to next step.
Replace bulb. Go to next step.
Remove jumpers and reconnect connectors. Warning light power circuits check good.
Remove fuse F24 and check for open condition.
Go to next step. Install fuse.
Locate cause of overload condition and repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F24, measure voltage from circuit A13H to ground.
Install fuse. Go to next step.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuits A13/A13H, then repair. Install fuse.
Remove alarm (211) and at cavity B, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A13B, then repair.
Reconnect alarm. Alarm power circuits check good.
